newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.

text.p: Singapore government securities ended narrowly mixed in moderate trade on retail and interbank interest, dealers said on Wednesday.

"The interbank rate slipped further today but there was still little impact on the market. Treasury bill yields were slightly higher but bond prices were slightly lower. Volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at a yield of 1.70/1.65 percent compared with Tuesday's yield of 1.62/1.57 percent and one-year at 1.58/1.53 percent against 1.50/1.45 percent.
Among bonds, July 1998 ended at S$99.30/99.35 from Tuesday's close of S$99.36/99.41, September 2001 at S$99.41/99.46 versus S$99.45/99.50 and June 2003 at S$99.08/99.13 against S$99.15/99.20.
The overnight interbank offered rate slipped to 2-5/8 2-1/2 percent from Tuesday's 2-3/4 2-5/8 percent.
